questions.question: What is the name of the metal-organic framework discussed in the text?
What is the pressure range within which CUK-1 undergoes a reversible structural contraction?
What is the stored energy capacity of CUK-1 as mentioned in the text?
Does the transition from open to contracted form in CUK-1 involve a change in space group?
questions.answer: No, the space group remains the same (C2/c) throughout the transition.

questions.question: What method was used to directly observe the contracted form of CUK-1?
questions.answer: High pressure single crystal X-ray diffraction

questions.question: What is the unit cell volume change percentage observed for CUK-1 during the transition?
Is the transition from the open to contracted form in CUK-1 reversible?
questions.answer: Yes, the transition is fully reversible.

questions.question: What computational method was used to gain insight into the mechanical behavior of CUK-1?
At what temperature were the molecular dynamics simulations conducted to study CUK-1?
Does the energy profile computed for CUK-1(Mg) at 0 K show a local minimum at lower unit cell volumes?
questions.answer: No, it does not show a local minimum at lower unit cell volumes.

questions.question: What is the main factor contributing to the ideal spring-like behavior of CUK-1?
questions.answer: The entropic contributions stabilize the open form and destabilize the contracted form.

questions.question: What is the role of dispersion interactions in the transition of CUK-1?
questions.answer: Dispersion interactions between stacking aromatic linkers play a role but are not solely responsible for the transition.

questions.question: What is the estimated unit cell volume of the contracted form of CUK-1(Co) based on mercury intrusion measurements?
Is the behavior of CUK-1 under pressure similar to that of MIL-53(M)/MIL-47(V)?
questions.answer: No, CUK-1 exhibits an ideal spring-like behavior without hysteresis, unlike MIL-53(M)/MIL-47(V).

questions.question: What is the significance of the linker configuration in CUK-1's pressure response?
questions.answer: The linker configuration, involving a dual-hinged pivot and a single hinge configuration, mediates the free energy landscape to yield a spring-like response.

questions.question: What is the pressure applied to achieve the contracted form of CUK-1 in the high pressure SC-XRD experiments?
Does CUK-1 exhibit any hysteresis upon cycling between open and contracted forms?
questions.answer: No, CUK-1 does not exhibit any hysteresis upon cycling.

questions.question: What is the role of aromatic stacking interactions in CUK-1's structural transition?
questions.answer: Aromatic stacking interactions are weaker in CUK-1 compared to MIL-53(M)/MIL-47(V), contributing to its reversible transition.

questions.question: What is the crystal system and space group of CUK-1 before and after the transition?
Is the transition pressure for CUK-1 similar for both its Co and Mg forms?
questions.answer: Yes, the transition pressure is similar for both Co and Mg forms of CUK-1.
